intro: Desfontainia, commonly known as the false holly or Indian holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences that resemble flowers. Desfontainia species typically have smooth, often thorny bark and produce small, fleshy fruits. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
